intro:
Just know I'm not a web developer, programmer or software cracker. If you ever think that I am, you wouldn't be the first.

I'm a geek. No more, no less.

post.body: I got tired of waiting for a solution to access my profile on my new phones, was missing ZeroMe, so here's my new one.

I wonder why my new profile that's on the new hub transmitted from my new primary phone to my new secondary phone just fine when they couldn't load from the phones with the profile on orangehub. Is orangehub glitched?

4G hotspot is still faster than DSL even when DSL gets much higher reported speeds at my apartment. Everything loads faster. I'm quite happy. I don't understand why the lower bandwidth and higher latency doesn't mean a slower experience, but there's nothing to complain about.

I've thought about working on logos/icons for ZeroNet sites every now and then. I've done this for a now long gone website for free and the admin loved them. I've learned that sharpness matters because if it's blurry it can hurt people's eyes since their eyes are trying to focus on the image to make it sharper. I've demonstrated more than the glorified pixel art you see below, though never learned how to do vectors. What I did for the original logo for that website is make the text a better shape pixel by pixel and softened it, basically antialiasing it, then making all sorts of different material versions for that and my avatar. I was making animated GIFs and animated PNGs. I've pretty much learned all I needed to with all the time in the world to do it.

The two issues are that I only know how to use Photoshop and I don't even have a PC set up, but if there will be an incentive to make icons, then I'll fix the latter and also look into what I can figure out with GIMP to fix the former.
I'll be grabbing a piece of paper and marker to properly mockup a social network mobile interface. The first one is kind of a template for improving upon the concept. For now, however, I shall sleep.

___

comment.body: If you had to redownload your hub and you clicked Create Profile before your hub was fully synced, then you had tricked the hub into overwriting your pre-existing profile. This is a common glitch.
https://ring.cx/
I was informed that Wire's severs use proprietary software (edit: They lied, so nevermind).
@ZAlex: Thank you for correcting me. I see that someone had lied to me about Wire now.
Content.json fails to download.
I've been looking for instructions on how this is done.
It would be unusual to me if ZeroNet users didn't like SoaD.
@Kaffie: Might this be what you're looking for?
I have a cheap prepaid Android phone and the performance seems just fine to me, but storage is limited on lower end phones.
Last I knew, 2GB is the limit.
This is what I use and financially support.
@Nofish: I myself am uncertain of bitcoin's future. I think Ethereum has more promise since they're being extremely careful to avoid proof of work and proof of stake pitfalls.
@Nofish: I'm looking for a cryptocoin that is resistant to 51% attacks and the like, but you're far more knowledgeable, I assume.
Confirmed we're paranoid. :D
@Nofish: So... how are things?

I don't consider ZeroNet a darknet or deepweb, but maybe I'm mistaken. Chinese users have cited privacy concerns. If you can be found on ZeroNet not being careful, then that's similar to the clearnet.

I look at ZeroNet as a protocol not yet adopted by W3C.

I think ZeroNet's current draw is that websites have infinitely scalable bandwidth and are resistant to DDoS attacks, cutting down hosting and admin costs. It also has interplanetary potential.

Look at ZeroNet as the web of the future.
@Kaffie: I agree, but I think ZeroNet goes against the fascist, megacorporatist establishment enough that they see it as a threat.
@Nofish: I'm glad to see you're feeling positive. Stress is a killer, really most everyone's biggest threat. Keep your head up high, bro. You're one of a kind.
@Border0464fred: Agreed. That guy isn't much help if he isn't coding.
Consider me deeply confused by the comparison.

*ChromaHub

:)

But yeah, compression would be helpful since some of us are running Zeronet-Kivy on Android. Desktop and dedicated servers would be the perfect archival peers while mobile users just browse fresh content with limited IPC and storage.
Steemit.com is a clearnet site resembling Reddit, but instead of getting upvotes you get paid in Steem cryptocurrency. It runs on a blockchain, but I see no decentralization in its server fabric.
I see someone deleted their duplicate search engine submissions. Muwahahahahaha! I am first!
@ÁãóËõã: He said he would in this thread.
ZeroHello settings? I've been missing out on this information.

After I reinstall ZeroNet I can no longer edit or delete my submissions. They weren't duplicates when they were submitted, but people like the descriptions of other submissions more. So anyways I wish I could delete mine, but I can't after ZN reinstall.

I don't want posts to be duplicated, because that gets annoying. It's an issue I have with Google+. You would see maybe ten copies of the same post. Mastodon has "boost," which I think means to bump a post (bring a post to the top of the stream again). I'd prefer boost/bump.
@Nofish: Today I have experienced Android Instant Apps for the first time. Is it possible for ZeroNet to host Android Instant Apps?

@Gnuru Wanabi: I wanted to make a case for ZeroNet on F-Droid too. It seems you've done this in spades. Kindle users would appreciate this as well.

F-Droid also supports Tor
This happens to me seemingly when I go to a hotspot that isn't my own.
Yeah Reddit is being controlled by corporate statists now. Reddit as a whole is censoring everything that goes against their sponsored spam.

I propose multiple video quality switchover for streaming, a way for USV to downgrade to lower quality/smaller size versions of a video if the download speed isn't fast enough to keep up with higher quality video playback.

Or if the video format supports displaying video frames in less detail due to inadequate bandwidth. I remember how image files like JPEG would start off blocky on slow connections and then increase in resolution as the download progresses. Perhaps that  would work brilliantly for WebTorrent.

I don't know if or which video formats have that characteristic.

Also, I'm not a coder.

It's just an idea.
@Universal Smart Video: You're welcome. :)
People are so obsessed with meta-mega-feline audio that it's ridiculous.
I appreciate the user search feature. Now my family and friends can find me and one another.
@Kaffie: Oh. Perhaps that's new?

I've proposed ZeroNet be more like a webapp ecosystem and store. That is the only thing that will draw more people in, IMO. The good news is this can be done without actually forking the project, even if Tamas doesn't make this change. It only requires a site that pretends to be a store with reviews for them so you know what you're getting into. Then another site that is a revamped launcher style for ZeroHello. Maybe it will require a soft fork at most.

@Ivesen: That's good idea. My only remaining issue is that mobile devices have a poor ZeroNet experience on most browsers, but you're on track with the main idea. A Chrome extension like that working in Android browsers such as Yandex and Opera would be amazing.
@Ivesen: Then Tamas should fix the UI and ZeroHello. That's one reason why I think a soft fork might be needed for resolve until then.

@Ivesen: It's quite usable with the right browsers. Clicking is the big problem, small bug but it's unnoticed when you have the right browser for it. The Android-like webapp idea can take the backseat to that small bug.
Google did this to me a few months ago, and it creeps me out.

Google tracks offline purchases and I was an early victim of it.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd/1495756753

@FlappyEarz: Google tracks your debit/credit card without a phone. Read the article linked in the post I linked to. Your phone could be a million pieces since 7 years ago and yet Google tracks your every purchase BY CARD.
@FlappyEarz: You didn't read the article and you're a troll.

Create the same ID on two different providers and see what you can figure out.
How is USV coming along?
PeakID doesn't work for me, but PolarID does. However, I don't like that PolarID allows duplicate names.
@Krixano: No stories are visible.
@Krixano: I created a profile, but after refreshing, it acts like I didn't create a profile and doesn't seem to let me do anything after that.
For some reason ZeroMedium isn't letting me do anything either. It used to be functional.

@Krixano: I can't sign in, but I was signed in and it's unresponsive to anything that involves one's own IDs and profile. Refreshing the page doesn't help.

It's both zites, so why do both of them not work unless the code is broken?
@Krixano: Chrome and Fully Kiosk Browser
@Krixano: See my latest post.
@Krixano: No menus show after signing up or signing in.
Nothing works except browsing categories and pre-existing posts. Of course one has posts and the other doesn't.
Oh. I didn't know what you meant by reload and rebuild, apparently. I never needed the right sidebar.
@Krixano: ZeroMedium is still not cooperating, but ZeroMedium [DEV] is more cooperative.
When I Rebuild on ZM , three files aren't rebuilt. The rebuilt files is three short of the total files.
@Krixano: No problem. Tag me when you figure it out.

I can't wait. My political poetry is looking for a home. BTW, ZM is mobile friendly. I love that you got this down from the very beginning, but the categories bar cuts off in either screen orientation. Make it scrollable, please.

Italics and bold are switched around for Google+ . Can you have underscores for italics and asterisks for bold instead, or is it more consistent/standard having asterisks for italics and underscores for bold?
@Krixano: Damnit. I always overlook something.
@Krixano: (nagging) Please fix the categories bar cutting off on phone screens.
@Krixano: Good luck, bro! I love what you've accomplished so far!
You're right, but taking a photo on the spot works.
For some reason the article text is missing. Edit: A line break between the text and photo makes the text visible.
I've figured it out. You need to put text in both fields first or the image won't show.
I can upload photos just fine. It's weird about it, but it doesn't stop me.
It's a blurred ultra low resolution version of the photo.
and ready to install malware.
I just had to comment to say your avatar is awesome. Maybe it could inspire an update to the ZeroNet logo.
That's probably a good place for my political poem. I want to see original content and open collaboration on it from ZeroNet.

I don't mind. A small performance hit is better than ads that break pages and video players, attempt to install wares or annoy the shit out of you.

It's win/win.
@43110: Political posts are just as welcome. You may write about anything of any importance.
Can I retag my story as art or poetry?

I was wondering if anyone had tried beautifulsoup. I've linked to it. It might cover a few bases for you.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd/1510846484
@Krixano: Yes. Art is a general term. Poetry is a precursor and sometimes key to rap music and musicians are regarded as artists. The logic is sound.
@Krixano: Umbrella tags couldn't hurt. Yes

**Spoken word is a performance art that is word based. It is an oral art that focuses on the aesthetics of word play and intonation and voice inflection. It is a 'catchall' which includes any kind of poetry recited aloud, including hip hop, jazz poetry, poetry slams, traditional poetry readings and can include comedy routines and 'prose monologues'.**


So, if there's a track or video that goes along with written poetry, that's spoken word.
Forced essays are so fun... NOT!
This means that when I'm told to create a profile that I can resume using an old profile. Got it.
@Git Center: You've completely missed two threads on ZeroTalk that confirm there is a bug after downloading ZeroMe, after hubs are downloaded.
@Git Center: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1512311792_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd

@Git Center: The workaround that this post is about is to allow reselection of a hub that a user selected before. Delete ZeroMe while keeping the hubs, redownload ZeroMe and you'll see it asks you to select a hub.
@Git Center: I've tried that. You don't need to play a skeptic on a bug found by @missesrobot: and I.
@Git Center: Sorry. I assumed you read both threads in their entirety.

@Git Center: Agreed. I like the hub reselection feature though. At least I think this can be useful. I'm not certain. A few hubs advertise having higher data limits, so I'm assuming that is relevant for people who have to select a hub.
I and a few others have multiple profiles on the same ID which we can now resume the use of, at least.
@Git Center: Would be nice to have the option to merge-migrate the multiple profile posts into one hub and one profile while deleting the other profiles.
@Krixano: Yes. I'm not bothering with the complex fix.
I edited in what I forgot to draw in the post text.
Also mentioned favor for ZeroMedium custom image placement among text.

Actually, place the Heart, Comment and Share counters/buttons above the post content. This way it fills in the space between the poster's avatar+name (to the right of the avatar) and the 0 button. I don't want site buttons overlapped by the 0 button.
Make it so new posts automatically show but don't push down the content currently displayed on the screen.
Next to the Heart, Comment and Share buttons/counters could be a dropdown arrow to show who Hearted, Commented and Shared.

A few repos fail to download content.json

Your posts and everyone's comments on your posts are on the hub you chose for your account when you created it. To see someone else's posts and the comments on those posts, you have to have downloaded the hub they signed up with.
Backup your users.json file.
It should work. I've reported a bug on it for the only platform that had missing libraries.

@Infected: Android was missing a library that prevented ZM working in the past but was fixed months ago. I've no idea what is causing your problem, but your name doesn't pull up in ZM. Maybe that's a start. Are you signed in?
@Infected: What changed?

@Infected: I think you figured it out yourself, but you're welcome to our willingness to help.

--Your Interneighbors
You should convert the SVG images to base64 whenever you have free time. I used to think there was a problem downloading the logo. SVG doesn't work on all browsers, especially Android.
I'm always excited to see what you make. Cheers on the rewrite.
I do wish there was an indication whether a video is seeded (to me that means someone has the whole file ready to download) by any peers or not. I guess this can be seen as a feature.
@Git Center: I haven't. Thank you for the link!
